Description: Fragment of undyed, plain weave, linen cloth (garment?); Tapestry bands (on grouped warp threads) in linen and dark blue wool of geometric designs of rows of reversing stepped triangles separated by narrow barred stripes; Warp: linen, S spun, c.20 tpc; Weft: linen and wool, S spun, c.19 tpc in plain areas, c.50 in tapestry; Edges ragged.
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, red box; Key to early dating is barred stripes, created by using the blue and white threads alternatively. Information from hero Granger-Taylor (6.6.1990)
Condition: Fragmentary but good where wool survives. At date unknown stuck to sticky net.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
